sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些副词均含"几乎不"之意。
means: hardly ： 指接近最低限度，差不多没有多余，强调困难和程度。
scarcely ： 指不太充分，不太够，不足，不能令人满意，强调数量。
barely ： 指仅仅够，一点不多，强调没有多余。

sentence.Network_en: Dave pulled a back muscle and could barely kick the ball.
sentence.Network_cn: 戴夫背部拉伤，几乎没法踢球。

sentence.Network_en: There was barely time for the two boys to escape unseen.
sentence.Network_cn: 两个男孩想趁人不备偷偷溜走几乎是来不及的。

sentence.Network_en: The commission had barely begun to make a dent in the problem.
sentence.Network_cn: 委员会几乎还没有在这个问题上取得任何进展。

entry.def: You use barely to say that  something is only just true or only just the case.

example.ex: Anastasia could barely remember the ride to the hospital...
example.tran: 阿纳斯塔西娅几乎记不起来怎么去的医院。

example.ex: It was 90 degrees and the air conditioning barely cooled the room...
example.tran: 当时气温达到了90度，空调也不能让房间凉快多少。

entry.def: If you say that one thing had barely happened when something else happened, you mean that the first event was followed immediately by the second.

example.ex: The Boeing 767 had barely taxied to a halt before its doors were flung open...
example.tran: 这架波音767刚刚停住，它的舱门就弹开了。

example.ex: Barely had the bulldozers started when Museum of London archaeologists swooped.
example.tran: 推土机刚一启动，伦敦博物馆的考古学家们就蜂拥而至了。

sentences.sentence: "had scarcely rung the bell when the door flew open"
"would have scarce arrived before she would have found some excuse to leave"- W.B.Yeats

means.word_mean: 2. in a sparse or scanty way;

auth_sentence.content: For long stretches, our hero is barely there.
auth_sentence.res_content: For long stretches, our hero is barely there.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: For long stretches, our hero is barely there.

auth_sentence.content: For starters, you could barely even discuss it.
auth_sentence.res_content: For starters, you could barely even discuss it.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: For starters, you could barely even discuss it.

auth_sentence.content: His barrage of questions barely left time for answers.
auth_sentence.res_content: His barrage of questions barely left time for answers.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: His barrage of questions barely left time for answers.

Sentence.sentence: Sales in 2009 could be barely half of that.
At the same time, technological innovation (创新) will barely pause for breath, and two big political changes seem likely
and employs barely 9% of the nation's workers.

means.word_mean: 仅仅, 只不过, 几乎不

sentences.en: We barely had time to catch the train.
sentences.cn: 我们几乎来不及赶火车。

sentences.en: I had barely come in when the telephone rang.
sentences.cn: 我刚进来, 电话就响了。

means.word_mean: 赤裸裸地; 光秃秃地, 空空地

jushi.english: We could barely see the other cars because of the fog.
jushi.chinese: 因为有雾，我们几乎看不到别的汽车。

jushi.english: We have barely enough money to last the weekend.
jushi.chinese: 我们的钱只能勉强维持到周末。
他房间几乎没什么家具。
